text: Hi Ranjit, It is tricky to know what you want to become when studying for A Levels.  I know I changed my mind numerous times and still didn't become a Journalist :grinning:... which is what I thought I would be. A lot of people I work with have a couple of different roles at once or have retrained throughout the years to do different jobs. My advice would be to look at what you enjoy doing inside and outside of studies. I can see you have an interest in Science there. Maths and Science are great subjects for VFX and CGI roles such as; <https://www.accessvfx.org/careers>  But sometimes its easier to strip things back to what do you enjoy?
Yh i do find science interesting and i enjoy doing chemistry as a subject but i appreciate your advice i will try to find out more about what i enjoy thank you:smiley:

Making a list of what you enjoy will help to look at the types of roles that may interest you. I've had to re-look at this at different points of my career too :smiley: Let me know if there are particular roles you would like to know more about too. We have lots of roles at Aardman, for example!
